column4: heres a key question for me:  if i try to install ubuntu over a broken install on my mac ... will i be able to do that without formating the drive? in other words, can i do this without losing the 40 gb of movies i collected under ubuntu ?
what's broken about it?
well. i removed gnome panel because gnome complained when it started up. Then i discovered that there is no net connection any more, so i cant apt-get gnome panel back in there.
it started with a shut-off i think
use "apt-cdrom" to rescue yourself
is that a program of its own ?
boot your machine to the console, and use apt-cdrom to fix yourself
i havent even found a good way to boot a ubuntu machine to a plain console
when your machine gets up (as far as it gets) hit ctrl-alt-f3
ok ... and then apt-cdrom ... with the PPC cdrom install cd in the drive.  would it be harmless to do some sort of apt-get remove gnome, apt get install gnome ?
you can try whatever you like
breezy will be out oct 13 and you and apt-cdrom your way to a dist-upgrade of the whole box
you are not gonna be able to fix with the livecd, i dont think

ok maybe not ...  actually i just wanted to see the iMac boot into a non-broken state with the liveCD. Very surprising that i get gnome errors there too ....  when gnome has been running happily in the installed environment, before
that IS surprising
language please
ctrl-alt-f3
try "gmplayer"
i find the ppc version of mplayer lacking sorely
well... could be, but there should at least be some sort of RESULT left to RUN after i have done an INSTALL ...   :)
were you successful?
